poem:
Title: "Chartres in Autumn"

In Rouen, a morning dressed,
In the cloak of violence, unrest.
A shattered peace, a fire's stoke,
Echoes of a Molotov cocktail smoke.

The synagogue, once grand and great,
Now wears the heavy weight,
Of a tragedy deep, the world asleep,
In the heart of Rouen, the wounds seep.

Our reflection in the shattered pane,
Humanity's face drenched in pain.
